description: See degrade and compare French degré (“step”).

adjectives.description: degraded (comparative more degraded, superlative most degraded)

entries.meaning: Feeling or having undergone degradation; deprived of dignity or self-respect.
(biology) Having the typical characters or organs in a partially developed condition, or lacking certain parts.
examples: The Grapsoid species are represented of a degraded form in Porcellana

entries.meaning: (heraldry, not comparable) Having steps; said of a cross whose extremities end in steps growing larger as they leave the centre; on degrees.
simple past tense and past participle of degrade
